page.title: 10Geology of the Area
page.content:
The solid rock of the area is Chalk,which was laid down in a warm shallow sea some 100 M years ago. Chalk is quarried at Newport, and formerly in many small farm quarries for spreading on fields to improve the soil structure. Most of the Chalk is covered by Chalky Boulder Clay deposited by the Anglian Glaciation 700,000yrs ago. This has sealed the normally permeable Chalk and this means that farmers have installed subsoil drains, with the aid of Government grants. Thw lack of solid stone means that timber or brick is thw normal traditional building material.
I.J.Roper B.Sc. M.Sc.
